Alan Bean.label: Alan Bean
Alan Bean.description: Alan LaVern Bean is a former NASA astronaut and currently a painter. Bean was selected to become an astronaut by NASA in 1963 as part of Astronaut Group 3. Wikipedia
Artwork: That's How It Felt To Walk On The Moon
Are You Ready for Some Football? - If We Could Do It All Over Again

Aleksandr Ivanchenkov.label: Aleksandr Ivanchenkov
Aleksandr Ivanchenkov.description: Aleksandr Sergeyevich Ivanchenkov is a retired Soviet cosmonaut who flew as Flight Engineer on Soyuz 29 and Soyuz T-6, he spent 147 days, 12 hours and 37 minutes in space. Wikipedia

Aleksandr Samokutyayev.label: Aleksandr Samokutyayev
Aleksandr Samokutyayev.description: Aleksandr Mikhailovich Samokutyayev is a Russian cosmonaut. Samokutyayev served as a Flight Engineer for the International Space Station long duration Expedition 27/28 missions. He also served as the Soyuz TMA-21 commander. Wikipedia

Anthony W. England.label: Anthony W. England
Anthony W. England.description: Anthony Wayne England, better known as Tony England, is a former NASA astronaut. Selected in 1967, England was among of group of astronauts who served as backups during the Apollo and Skylab programs. Wikipedia

Bruce McCandless II.label: Bruce McCandless II
Bruce McCandless II.description: Bruce McCandless II is a former naval aviator with the United States Navy and former NASA astronaut. During the first of his two Space Shuttle missions he made the first ever untethered free flight using the Manned Maneuvering Unit in 1984. Wikipedia

Bjarni Tryggvason.label: Bjarni Tryggvason
Bjarni Tryggvason.description: Bjarni V. Tryggvason is an Icelandic-born Canadian engineer and a former NRC/CSA astronaut. He served as a Payload Specialist on Space Shuttle mission STS-85 in 1997, a 12-day mission to study changes in the Earth’s atmosphere. Wikipedia

Christer Fuglesang.label: Christer Fuglesang
Christer Fuglesang.description: Arne Christer Fuglesang is a Swedish physicist and an ESA astronaut. He was first launched aboard the STS-116 Space Shuttle mission on December 10, 2006, at 0147 GMT, making him the first Swedish citizen in space. Wikipedia

Charles Edward Jones.label: Charles Edward Jones
Charles Edward Jones.description: Colonel Charles Edward Jones was a United States Air Force officer, a computer programmer, and an astronaut in the USAF Manned Spaceflight Engineer Program. Wikipedia
Charles Edward Jones.Died: September 11, 2001, New York City, New York, United States

Claude Nicollier.label: Claude Nicollier
Claude Nicollier.description: Claude Nicollier is the first astronaut from Switzerland, and has flown on four Space Shuttle missions. His first spaceflight was in 1992, and his final spaceflight was in 1999. He took part in two servicing missions to the Hubble Space Telescope. Wikipedia

Daniel M. Tani.label: Daniel M. Tani
Daniel M. Tani.description: Daniel M. Tani is an American engineer and a NASA astronaut. Although born in Ridley Park, Pennsylvania, he considers Lombard, Illinois, to be his hometown. With Peggy Whitson, Tani conducted the 100th spacewalk on the International Space Station. Wikipedia
Daniel M. Tani.Born: February 1, 1961 (age 53), Ridley Park, Pennsylvania, United States

Donald Pettit.label: Donald Pettit
Donald Pettit.description: Donald Roy Pettit is an American chemical engineer and a NASA astronaut. He is a veteran of two long-duration stays aboard the International Space Station, one space shuttle mission and a six-week expedition to find meteorites in Antarctica. Wikipedia

Duane G. Carey.label: Duane G. Carey
Duane G. Carey.description: Duane Gene "Digger" Carey is a retired lieutenant colonel in the United States Air Force and a former NASA astronaut. Wikipedia
Duane G. Carey.Born: April 30, 1957 (age 56), Saint Paul, Minnesota, United States

Elliot See.label: Elliot See
Elliot See.description: Elliot McKay See, Jr., was an American astronaut, selected in the second group of astronauts. He died in 1966 in a NASA trainer jet crash in St. Louis while training for what would have been his first space flight, Gemini 9. Wikipedia
Elliot See.Died: February 28, 1966, St. Louis, Missouri, United States

Edward Higgins White.label: Edward Higgins White
Edward Higgins White.description: Edward Higgins White, II was an engineer, U.S. Air Force officer, and NASA astronaut. On June 3, 1965, he became the first American to "walk" in space. Wikipedia
Edward Higgins White.Born: November 14, 1930, San Antonio, Texas, United States
Edward Higgins White.Died: January 27, 1967, Cape Canaveral, Florida, United States
Education: U.S. Air Force Test Pilot School

Fred Haise.label: Fred Haise
Fred Haise.description: Fred Wallace Haise, Jr. is an American engineer and former NASA astronaut. He is one of only 24 humans to have flown to the Moon, as Lunar Module Pilot on Apollo 13. Wikipedia
Movies: Apollo 13 Houston We've Had a Problem

Frederick D. Gregory.label: Frederick D. Gregory
Frederick D. Gregory.description: Frederick Drew Gregory is a former NASA astronaut and former NASA Deputy Administrator. He also served briefly as NASA Acting Administrator in early 2005, covering the period between the departure of ... Wikipedia

Georgy Dobrovolsky.label: Georgy Dobrovolsky
Georgy Dobrovolsky.description: Georgiy Timofeyevich Dobrovolsky was a Soviet cosmonaut. He is notable for being one of the only three people in history to die in outer space. Wikipedia

Guion Bluford.label: Guion Bluford
Guion Bluford.description: Dr. Guion Stewart “Guy” Bluford, Jr., is an engineer, NASA astronaut, and the first African American in space. Before becoming an astronaut, Bluford was a Colonel in the U.S. Air Force. Wikipedia
Education: Wharton School of the University of PennsylvaniaMore

Helen Sharman.label: Helen Sharman
Helen Sharman.description:
Helen Patricia Sharman, OBE PhD, is a British chemist who became the first Briton in space and the first woman to visit the Mir space station.
Sharman was born in Grenoside, Sheffield, later moving to Greenhill. Wikipedia

Igor Volk.label: Igor Volk
Igor Volk.description:
Igor Petrovich Volk is a retired cosmonaut and test pilot in the Soviet Union. He is married and has two children.
Igor Volk was selected as a cosmonaut on July 30, 1980, flew as Research Cosmonaut on Soyuz T-12, the 7th expedition to Salyut 7. Wikipedia

Jean-Loup Chrétien.label: Jean-Loup Chrétien
Jean-Loup Chrétien.description: Jean-Loup Jacques Marie Chrétien is a French retired Général de Brigade in the Armée de l'Air, and a former CNES spationaut. He flew on two Franco-Soviet space missions and a NASA Space Shuttle mission. Wikipedia

Jerome Apt.label: Jerome Apt
Jerome Apt.description: Jerome III "Jay" Apt, Ph.D. is an American astronaut and professor at Carnegie Mellon University. Before he became an astronaut, Apt was a physicist who worked on the Venus space probe project, and used ... Wikipedia

Jim Lovell.label: Jim Lovell
Jim Lovell.description: James Arthur "Jim" Lovell, Jr., is a former NASA astronaut and a retired captain in the United States Navy, most famous as the commander of the Apollo 13 mission, which suffered a critical failure en ... Wikipedia
Books: Lost Moon The Perilous Voyage of Apollo 13

Joe Engle.label: Joe Engle
Joe Engle.description: Joe Henry Engle is a retired U.S. Air Force Major General and a former NASA astronaut. He was married to Mary Catherine Lawrence of Mission Hills, Kansas and has two grown children and one stepchild. Wikipedia

John E. Blaha.label: John E. Blaha
John E. Blaha.description: John Elmer Blaha is a retired United States Air Force colonel and a former NASA astronaut. He is a veteran of six Space Shuttle missions and a stay on the Mir space station. Wikipedia
John E. Blaha.Born: August 26, 1942 (age 71), San Antonio, Texas, United States

John L. Phillips.label: John L. Phillips
John L. Phillips.description: John Lynch Phillips, PhD is a NASA astronaut. Phillips is also a Naval Aviator and retired Captain, United States Navy Reserve. Phillips has received numerous awards and special honors. Wikipedia

John M. Grunsfeld.label: John M. Grunsfeld
John M. Grunsfeld.description: John Mace Grunsfeld is an American physicist and a former NASA astronaut. He is a veteran of five Space Shuttleflights and has served as NASA Chief Scientist. Wikipedia

Kalpana Chawla.label: Kalpana Chawla
Kalpana Chawla.description: Kalpana Chawla was born in Karnal, India. She was the first Indian-American astronaut and first Indian woman in space. She first flew on Space Shuttle Columbia in 1997 as a mission specialist and primary robotic arm operator. Wikipedia

Leonid Kadeniuk.label: Leonid Kadeniuk
Leonid Kadeniuk.description: Leonid Kostyantynovych Kadenyuk, born 28 January 1951 in Klishkivtsi, Chernivtsi Oblast of the Ukrainian SSR is the first astronaut of independent Ukraine. He made his flight on NASA's Columbia in 1997 as part of the international mission STS-87. Wikipedia

Lev Dyomin.label: Lev Dyomin
Lev Dyomin.description: Lev Stepanovich Dyomin was a Soviet cosmonaut who flew on the Soyuz 15 spaceflight in 1974. This spaceflight was intended to dock with the space station Salyut 3, but the docking failed. Wikipedia

Lisa Nowak.label: Lisa Nowak
Lisa Nowak.description: Lisa Marie Nowak is a former American naval flight officer and NASA astronaut. Born in Washington, D.C., she was selected by NASA in 1996 and qualified as a mission specialist in robotics. Wikipedia

Liu Boming (astronaut).label: Liu Boming
Liu Boming (astronaut).description: Liu Boming is a Chinese pilot selected as part of the Shenzhou program. A fighter pilot in the People's Liberation Army Air Force, he was selected to be an CNSA member in 1998. Wikipedia

Maksim Surayev.label: Maksim Surayev
Maksim Surayev.description: Maksim Viktorovich Surayev is a Russian cosmonaut. Wikipedia

Loren Shriver.label: Loren Shriver
Loren Shriver.description: Loren James Shriver is a former NASA astronaut, aviator, and a retired US Air Force Colonel. Wikipedia
Education: U.S. Air Force Test Pilot School

Mamoru Mohri.label: Mamoru Mohri
Mamoru Mohri.description: Mamoru "Mark" Mohri, AM is a Japanese scientist, a former NASDA astronaut, and a veteran of two NASA space shuttle missions. Wikipedia

Marc Garneau.label: Marc Garneau
Marc Garneau.description: Joseph Jean-Pierre Marc Garneau, C.C., CD, Ph.D., F.C.A.S.I., MP is a Canadian politician, retired military officer, former astronaut, and engineer. He has served as the Member of Parliament for the riding of Westmount—Ville-Marie since 2008. Wikipedia
Marc Garneau.type: Member of the Canadian House of Commons
Office: Member of the Canadian House of Commons since 2008

Michael Coats.label: Michael Coats
Michael Coats.description: Michael Lloyd Coats is a former NASA astronaut, raised in Riverside, California. From December 2005 to December 2012, he served as Director of the Johnson Space Center in Houston, Texas. Wikipedia

Michael Foale.label: Michael Foale
Michael Foale.description: Colin Michael Foale, CBE, PhD is a British-American astrophysicist and former NASA astronaut. He is a veteran of six space shuttle missions and extended stays on both Mir and the International Space Station. Wikipedia

Michael J. Bloomfield.label: Michael J. Bloomfield
Michael J. Bloomfield.description: Michael John "Bloomer" Bloomfield is a former American astronaut and a veteran of three Space Shuttle missions. Wikipedia

Michael J. Massimino.label: Michael J. Massimino
Michael J. Massimino.description: Michael James "Mike" Massimino is an American engineer and a NASA astronaut. Massimino is a veteran of two Space Shuttle missions, both of which serviced the Hubble Space Telescope, including the historic final repair mission. Wikipedia
Michael J. Massimino.Born: August 19, 1962 (age 51), Oceanside, New York, United States
Education: H. Frank Carey Junior-Senior High School

Mike Melvill.label: Mike Melvill
Mike Melvill.description: Michael Winston "Mike" Melvill is an Earthrounder and one of the test pilots for SpaceShipOne, the experimental spaceplane developed by Scaled Composites. Wikipedia
Movies: Mojave Magic A Turtle's Eye View of SpaceShipOne

Mike Mullane.label: Mike Mullane
Mike Mullane.description: Richard Michael "Mike" Mullane is a retired USAF officer and a former NASA astronaut, flying on three Space Shuttle missions. Wikipedia
Mike Mullane.Born: September 10, 1945 (age 68), Wichita Falls, Texas, United States

Musa Manarov.label: Musa Manarov
Musa Manarov.description: Musa Khiramanovich Manarov is a Soviet Azerbaijani cosmonaut who has spent 541 days in space. He is an ethnic Adyghe from Northern Caucasus. Wikipedia

Norman Thagard.label: Norman Thagard
Norman Thagard.description: Norman Earl Thagard is an American scientist and former NASA astronaut. He is the first American to ride to space on board a Russian vehicle, and can be considered the first American cosmonaut. Wikipedia

Oleg Atkov.label: Oleg Atkov
Oleg Atkov.description: Oleg Yur'yevich At'kov is a Soviet cosmonaut. He is married with one child. Wikipedia
Oleg Atkov.Born: May 5, 1949 (age 64), Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic

Oleg Grigoryevich Makarov.label: Oleg Grigoryevich Makarov
Oleg Grigoryevich Makarov.description:
Oleg Grigoryevich Makarov was a Soviet cosmonaut.
Makarov was born in Udomlya, Tver Oblast, USSR. He graduated from Bauman Moscow Higher Technical School in 1957 and started working at the Special Design ... Wikipedia

Oleg Kotov.label: Oleg Kotov
Oleg Kotov.description: Oleg Valeriyevich Kotov was born on October 27, 1965, in Simferopol, Crimean oblast in the Ukrainian SSR. After a career as a physician assigned to the Soviet space program, he joined the Russian cosmonaut corps. Wikipedia

Paolo A. Nespoli.label: Paolo A. Nespoli
Paolo A. Nespoli.description: Paolo Angelo Nespoli is an Italian astronaut. In 2007, he first traveled into space aboard the Space Shuttle Discovery as a mission specialist of STS-120. Wikipedia
Education: Polytechnic Institute of New York University

Patrick G. Forrester.label: Patrick G. Forrester
Patrick G. Forrester.description: Patrick Graham Forrester is a retired United States Army officer and a NASA astronaut. At the time of his retirement from the U.S. Army, Forrester had achieved the rank of Colonel. He is married and has two children. Wikipedia
Patrick G. Forrester.Born: March 31, 1957 (age 56), El Paso, Texas, United States

Pavel Belyayev.label: Pavel Belyayev
Pavel Belyayev.description: Pavel Ivanovich Belyayev, was a Soviet fighter pilot with extensive experience in piloting different types of aircraft. Wikipedia

Pavel Popovich.label: Pavel Popovich
Pavel Popovich.description:
Pavel Romanovich Popovich was a Soviet cosmonaut.
He was the 4th cosmonaut in space, the 6th person in orbit, and the 8th person in space. Wikipedia

Peter Siebold.label: Peter Siebold
Peter Siebold.description: Peter Siebold is a member of the Scaled Composites astronaut team and was one of the test pilots for SpaceShipOne, the experimental spaceplane developed by Scaled Composites. Wikipedia

Pham Tuan.label: Pham Tuan
Pham Tuan.description: Phạm Tuân is a retired Vietnam Air Force aviator. He became the first Vietnamese citizen and the first Asian in space when he flew aboard the Soyuz 37 mission as an Intercosmos Research Cosmonaut. He was awarded the title Hero of the Soviet Union. Wikipedia

Richard R. Arnold.label: Richard R. Arnold
Richard R. Arnold.description: Richard Robert "Ricky" Arnold II is an American educator and a NASA astronaut. He flew on Space Shuttle mission STS-119, which launched March 15, 2009 and delivered the final set of solar arrays to the International Space Station. Wikipedia

Robert A. Parker.label: Robert B. Parker
Robert A. Parker.description: Robert Brown Parker was an American crime writer. His most famous works were the novels about the private detective Spenser. Wikipedia

Robert Crippen.label: Robert Crippen
Robert Crippen.description: Robert Laurel Crippen is a retired United States Navy Captain and former astronaut for the United States Department of Defense and for NASA. He was the pilot of the First Space Shuttle flight and flew three additional missions as commander. Wikipedia

Robert J. Cenker.label: Robert J. Cenker
Robert J. Cenker.description: Robert Joseph Cenker is an engineer and aerospace systems consultant who flew aboard Space Shuttle mission STS-61-C as Payload Specialist for RCA. Wikipedia

Robert L. Gibson.label: Robert L. Gibson
Robert L. Gibson.description: Robert Lee "Hoot" Gibson is a retired Captain and Naval Aviator in the United States Navy and a retired NASA astronaut. Wikipedia
Robert L. Gibson.Born: October 30, 1946 (age 67), Cooperstown, New York, United States

Robert L. Stewart.label: Robert L. Stewart
Robert L. Stewart.description: Robert Lee Stewart is a retired Brigadier General of the United States Army and a former NASA astronaut. Wikipedia

Roberta Bondar.label: Roberta Bondar
Roberta Bondar.description: Roberta Bondar OC O.Ont FRCP FRSC is Canada's first female astronaut and the first neurologist in space. Wikipedia

Rodolfo Neri Vela.label: Rodolfo Neri Vela
Rodolfo Neri Vela.description: Rodolfo Neri Vela is a Mexican scientist and astronaut who flew aboard a NASA Space Shuttle mission in the year 1985. He is the first and only Mexican, and the second Latin-American to have traveled to space. Wikipedia

Roger B. Chaffee.label: Roger B. Chaffee
Roger B. Chaffee.description: Roger Bruce Chaffee, was a Naval Aviator, aeronautical engineer and a NASA astronaut in the Apollo program. Wikipedia
Roger B. Chaffee.Born: February 15, 1935, Grand Rapids, Michigan, United States
Roger B. Chaffee.Died: January 27, 1967, Cape Canaveral Air Force Station, Florida, United States

Roger K. Crouch.label: Roger K. Crouch
Roger K. Crouch.description: Roger Keith Crouch is an American scientist who flew as a payload specialist on two NASA Space Shuttle missions in 1997. Wikipedia
Education: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

Rusty Schweickart.label: Rusty Schweickart
Rusty Schweickart.description: Russell Louis "Rusty" Schweickart aka Schweikart is an American former astronaut, research scientist, US Air Force fighter pilot, business and government executive. Wikipedia
Rusty Schweickart.Born: October 25, 1935 (age 78), Neptune Township, New Jersey, United States

Satoshi Furukawa.label: Satoshi Furukawa
Satoshi Furukawa.description: Satoshi Furukawa is a Japanese surgeon and a JAXA astronaut. Wikipedia

Scott Altman.label: Scott D. Altman
Scott Altman.description: Scott Douglas "Scooter" Altman is a United States Navy Captain test pilot and former NASA astronaut. He is a veteran of four Space Shuttle missions. His fourth mission on STS-125 was the last servicing mission to the Hubble Space Telescope. Wikipedia

Sheikh Muszaphar Shukor.label: Sheikh Muszaphar Shukor
Sheikh Muszaphar Shukor.description: Sheikh Muszaphar Shukor is a Malaysian orthopaedic surgeon and was the first Malaysian to go into space. He was launched to the International Space Station aboard Soyuz TMA-11 with the Expedition 16 crew on October 10, 2007. Wikipedia

Steven R. Nagel.label: Steven R. Nagel
Steven R. Nagel.description: Steven Ray Nagel is a retired Colonel in the USAF and a former NASA astronaut. Wikipedia

Sonny Carter.label: Sonny Carter
Sonny Carter.description: Manley Lanier "Sonny" Carter, Jr. was an American physician, professional soccer player, United States Navy officer, and NASA astronaut who flew on STS-33. Wikipedia

Steven MacLean (astronaut).label: Steve MacLean
Steven MacLean (astronaut).description:
Steven Glenwood MacLean is a Canadian astronaut. He was the President of the Canadian Space Agency, from September 1, 2008 to February 1, 2013.
He was born in Ottawa, Ontario, and is married to Nadine Wielgopolski of Hull, Quebec. Wikipedia

Story Musgrave.label: Story Musgrave
Story Musgrave.description: Franklin Story Musgrave is an American physician and a retired NASA astronaut. He is a public speaker and consultant to both Disney's Imagineering group and Applied Minds in California. Wikipedia
Education: Columbia University College of Physicians and Surgeons (1964)

Sunita Williams.label: Sunita Williams
Sunita Williams.description: Sunita Lyn "Suni" Williams née Pandya is a former American astronaut and a United States Navy officer. She holds the records for longest single space flight by a woman, total spacewalks by a woman, and most spacewalk time for a woman. Wikipedia

Susan J. Helms.label: Susan J. Helms
Susan J. Helms.description: Susan Jane Helms is a retired lieutenant general in the United States Air Force and a former NASA astronaut. Wikipedia
Susan J. Helms.Born: February 26, 1958 (age 56), Charlotte, North Carolina, United States

Takao Doi.label: Takao Doi
Takao Doi.description:
Takao Doi is a Japanese astronaut and a veteran of two NASA space shuttle missions.
Doi holds a doctorate from the University of Tokyo in aerospace engineering, and has studied and published in the ... Wikipedia

Terry Hart.label: Terry Hart
Terry Hart.description: Terry Jonathan Hart is a retired United States Air Force Lieutenant Colonel and former NASA astronaut. Wikipedia

Tracy Caldwell Dyson.label: Tracy Caldwell Dyson
Tracy Caldwell Dyson.description: Tracy Caldwell Dyson is an American chemist and NASA astronaut. Caldwell Dyson was a Mission Specialist on Space Shuttle Endeavour flight STS-118 in August 2007. Wikipedia

Umberto Guidoni.label: Umberto Guidoni
Umberto Guidoni.description: Umberto Guidoni is an Italian astrophysicist, science writer and a former ESA astronaut. He is a veteran of two NASA space shuttle missions. He was also a Member of the European Parliament from 2004 to 2009. Wikipedia

Valentin Lebedev.label: Valentin Lebedev
Valentin Lebedev.description: Valentin Vitaljevich Lebedev was a Soviet cosmonaut who made two flights into space. His stay aboard the Space Station Salyut 7 with Anatoly Berezovoy in 1982, which lasted 211 days, was recorded in the Guinness Book of Records. Wikipedia

Valeri Kubasov.label: Valeri Kubasov
Valeri Kubasov.description: Valeri Nikolayevich Kubasov was a Soviet cosmonaut who flew on two missions in the Soyuz programme as a flight engineer Soyuz 6 and Soyuz 19, and commanded Soyuz 36 in the Intercosmos programme. Wikipedia

Valeri Tokarev.label: Valeri Tokarev
Valeri Tokarev.description: Valeri Ivanovich Tokarev, Russian Air Force Colonel and test cosmonaut at the Yuri A. Gagarin Cosmonaut Training Center, was born October 29, 1952 in the town of Kap-Yar, Astrakhan Oblast and currently resides at Star City, Moscow Region. Wikipedia

Valery Rozhdestvensky.label: Valery Rozhdestvensky
Valery Rozhdestvensky.description:
Valery Ilyich Rozhdestvensky was a USSR cosmonaut.
Rozhdestvensky was born in Leningrad and graduated from the Higher Military Engineering School of Soviet Navy in Pushkin in engineering. Wikipedia

Vance D. Brand.label: Vance D. Brand
Vance D. Brand.description: Vance DeVoe Brand is a former test pilot and NASA astronaut. He served as command module pilot during the first U.S.-Soviet joint space flight in 1975, and as commander of three space shuttle missions. Wikipedia

Vladimir Kovalyonok.label: Vladimir Kovalyonok
Vladimir Kovalyonok.description: Vladimir Vasiliyevich Kovalyonok Belarusian Уладзі́мір Васі́льевіч Кавалёнак; Russian Влади́мир Васи́льевич Ковалёнок; born March 3, 1942 in Beloye, Minsk Oblast, Byelorussian SSR, is a retired Soviet cosmonaut. Wikipedia

William E. Thornton.label: William E. Thornton
William E. Thornton.description: William Edgar Thornton is a former NASA Astronaut. Thornton was born in Faison, North Carolina, and is married with two sons to the former Elizabeth Jennifer Fowler of Hertfordshire, England. Wikipedia
William E. Thornton.Born: April 14, 1929 (age 84), Faison, North Carolina, United States
Education: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

William Frederick Fisher.label: William Frederick Fisher
William Frederick Fisher.description: William Frederick Fisher is an American physician and a former NASA astronaut. Wikipedia

William R. Pogue.label: William R. Pogue
William R. Pogue.description: William Reid Pogue was an American astronaut and test pilot who was also an accomplished teacher, public speaker and author. Wikipedia
William R. Pogue.Died: March 4, 2014, Cocoa Beach, Florida, United States
Books: How Do You Go To The Bathroom In Space?

William Shepherd.label: William Shepherd
William Shepherd.description: William McMichael Shepherd is a former American astronaut who served as commander of Expedition 1, the first crew on the International Space Station. Shepherd is a recipient of the Congressional Space Medal of Honor. Wikipedia
William Shepherd.Born: July 26, 1949 (age 64), Oak Ridge, Tennessee, United States

William Anders.label: William Anders
William Anders.description: William Alison "Bill" Anders is a former United States Air Force officer, NASA astronaut and businessman. Wikipedia

Yang Liwei.label: Yang Liwei
Yang Liwei.description: Yang Liwei; born June 21, 1965 is a major general and military pilot and China National Space Administration astronaut. In 2003, he became the first person sent into space by the Chinese space program. Wikipedia

Yi So-Yeon.label: Yi So-Yeon
Yi So-Yeon.description: Yi So-yeon is a scientist who became the first Korean to fly in space. Wikipedia

Yuri Shargin.label: Yuri Shargin
Yuri Shargin.description:
Yuri Georgiyevich Shargin is a cosmonaut in the Russian Space Forces.
He was born March 20, 1960 in Engels, Saratov Oblast, Russian SFSR. He is divorced and has two children. Wikipedia

Yuri Baturin.label: Yuri Baturin
Yuri Baturin.description:
Yuri Mikhailovich Baturin, is a Russian cosmonaut and former politician.
Baturin graduated from the Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology in 1973, and is the former head of National Security; he is also an author in constitutional law. Wikipedia
Education: Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology

Yury Glazkov.label: Yury Glazkov
Yury Glazkov.description: Yury Nikolayevich Glazkov was a Soviet Air Force officer and a cosmonaut. Glazkov held the rank of major general in the Russian Air Force. Wikipedia

Zhai Zhigang.label: Zhai Zhigang
Zhai Zhigang.description: Zhai Zhigang is an officer in the People's Liberation Army Air Force and a CNSA astronaut. During the Shenzhou 7 mission in 2008, he became the first Chinese citizen to carry out a spacewalk. Wikipedia

Yury Usachov.label: Yury Usachov
Yury Usachov.description: Yury Vladimirovich Usachov is a former cosmonaut who resides in Star City, Moscow. Usachov is a veteran of four spaceflights, including two long duration missions on board the Mir Space Station and another on board the International Space Station. Wikipedia

Abdul Ahad Mohmand.label: Abdul Ahad Mohmand
Abdul Ahad Mohmand.description: Abdul Ahad Momand is a former Afghan Air Force aviator who became the first Afghan and 4th Muslim to journey to outer space. Wikipedia

Eugene Cernan.label: Eugene Cernan
Eugene Cernan.description: Eugene Andrew "Gene" Cernan is a retired American naval officer, fighter pilot and NASA astronaut. He has been into space three times as pilot of Gemini 9A in June 1966; as lunar module pilot of Apollo ... Wikipedia

Ronald J. Garan, Jr..label: Ronald J. Garan, Jr.
Ronald J. Garan, Jr..description: Ronald John Garan, Jr. is a NASA astronaut. After graduating from State University of New York College at Oneonta in 1982, he joined the Air Force, becoming a Second Lieutenant in 1984. Wikipedia
Ronald J. Garan, Jr..Born: October 30, 1961 (age 52), Yonkers, New York, United States
Education: State University of New York at Oneonta (1982)
